title: Ten years on - Central Expressway not in sight
byline: The estimated cost for the construction of phase 1 of the Central Expressway (Kadawata - Meerigama stretch) has more than doubled since 2015 when the project agreement was originally signed, a deputy minister said yesterday.

title: Fin. Min. rejects Excise proposal to bring Mendis back on track
byline: The Department of Excise, the competent authority managing the liquor industry is left with no other option but to seek the Attorney General’s assistance to deal with the Rs.5.8 billion tax evading W. M. Mendis and Co., as the financial plan proposed by the former to get the liquor giant back on track has reportedly been rejected by the Ministry of Finance, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Tata Motors with DIMO launches all-new passenger vehicle portfolio in SL
byline: Tata Motors, India’s leading automobile manufacturer and the pioneer of sustainable mobility, along with DIMO, the authority in automotive excellence for over 85 years and the sole authorised distributor for Tata Motors in Sri Lanka, launched the all-new range of passenger vehicles (including internal combustion engine (ICE) vehicles and electric vehicles (EVs)) in the country recently.

title: Apparel sector upbeat on prospects to achieve US$ 8bn export target
byline: Sri Lanka’s apparel industry is upbeat about future growth and expansion with industry leaders emphasising the need for greater collaboration and policy consistency to sustain the sector’s current growth momentum.

title: SL must return to int’l capital markets at some point: Dr. Coomaraswamy
byline: Adds cutting exposure to foreign holdings of rupee securities was deliberate to minimise volatility and troubles

title: Shooting injures one in Weliweriya
byline: A person was injured in a shooting incident at the Araliyagasdeka Junction in Weliweriya last night (13), police said.

title: Air quality level: Monaragala slightly unhealthy, Jaffna remains unhealthy
byline: Monaragala has recorded a slightly unhealthy air quality level, while Jaffna remains in the unhealthy air quality category today, the Vehicular Emission Test Trust Fund of the Department of Motor Traffic said.

title: Cannot expect anything from a government that placed a monkey in the fore: Thisakutti Arachchi
byline: People cannot expect anything from this government, as it has placed a monkey in front of everything else, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) former MP Thisakutti Arachchi said.

title: Ella-Wellawaya road blocked due to earthslip
byline: The Ella-Wellawaya road has been blocked near the 12th kilometre post due to an earthslip caused by adverse weather, police said.

title: US sanctions target Iranian oil network, including SL-based firm
byline: The U.S. Treasury has sanctioned Sri Lanka-based Marine Solution Pvt Ltd, the technical manager of the Barbados-flagged SHANNON II, for its involvement in shipping Iranian oil, the US Treasury Department said.

title: Former Boossa Prison Superintendent shot dead
byline: Former Superintendent of the Boossa Prison, Siridath Dhammika, was shot dead by an unidentified gunman in Thalagaha, Akmeemana a short while ago, police said.

title: Expert warns of health risks due to lack of sleep
byline: Sri Lanka is facing a sleep related problem that can lead to various physical and mental health issue due to not getting proper sleep, the Health Promotion Bureau said.

title: Chamara Sampath wants holiday for Parliament tomorrow due to animal survey
byline: Opposition MP Chamara Sampath today proposed that MPs must be given holidays tomorrow in line with the animal survey to be held tomorrow.

title: Kadugannawa-Pilimatalawa railway crossing closed for 32-hour maintenance
byline: The railway crossing at the 65-mile post on the upcountry railway line, between Kadugannawa and Pilimatalawa, will be closed for 32-hours for immediate track maintenance, the Railway Department announced.

title: Two elderly women hacked to death inside house in Muttur
byline: Two elderly women were hacked to death inside a house in Thahanagar, Muttur early today, Police said.

title: Musical artist Shan Putha arrested
byline: The popular musical artist Shan Putha has been arrested for possessing a 9mm firearm.

title: Electricity tariff will be reduced by 30% within three years: Minister
byline: The power tariffs will be reduced by 30 percent only within three years, Power and Energy Minister Kumara Jayakodi told Parliament today.

title: Passengers evacuate onto wing of burning American Airlines jet
byline: Passengers on an American Airlines flight were evacuated onto the tarmac of a Colorado airport as a fire broke out on the plane, sending smoke billowing into the air.

title: Mannar wind power project to be given to another company if Adani not interested: Minister
byline: The contract for the wind power project in Mannar will be given to another company if the Adani group is not interested, Minister of Power and Energy Kumara Jayakodi told Parliament today.

title: Hand grenade found in Anuradhapura rape suspect’s house
byline: A live hand grenade of a foreign make has been recovered from the house of the suspect in custody in connection with the rape of a lady doctor in the Anuradhapura Hospital.

title: New regulations for importing hybrid and electric vehicles announced
byline: Customs authorities have announced new regulations for importing motor vehicles, including hybrid and electric vehicles.

title: Batalanda Commission report tabled in Parliament
byline: The report of the Batalanda Commission which probed into the alleged torture of youth in 1988/89, was tabled in Parliament by Leader of the House Bimal Ratnayke today.

title: Customs seize Rs.32 million worth Cannabis oil sent by mail
byline: A Customs Inspector who tried to clear a consignment of Cannabis oil worth over Rs. 33 million sent from the USA to a local addressee, was apprehended by the Sri Lanka Customs at the Central Mail Exchange (CME) today.

title: Three directors of pyramid scheme company remanded over Rs. 1.5 Bn financial fraud
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali today remanded three directors of Smart Win Pvt Ltd till March 17 for allegedly operating an illegal pyramid financial scheme under the guise of a Wallapatta cultivation project, defrauding investors across the country of Rs. 1.5 billion.

title: SLMC National List MP resigns
byline: Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) National List MP Mohamed Sali Naleem has decided to step down from his Parliamentary seat to contest the upcoming Local Government elections.

title: Anuradhapura Hospital director removed
byline: In the wake of the sexual assault of a female doctor at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has removed the hospital’s director, Dr. Dulan Samaraweera from his position.

title: All geared-up to conduct first-ever animal census
byline: All arrangements have been made to conduct the first-ever animal census of crop-damaging animals tomorrow (15).

title: Over 1,200 elephants killed in the last five years
byline: Over the past five years, 1,238 elephants have tragically lost their lives due to various causes, with 138 deaths resulting from train accidents alone.

title: 2024 Grade Five scholarship exam: Cut-off marks released
byline: The Examinations Department today released the cut-off marks for the enrollment of students into Grade Six next year, based on the 2024 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination.

title: Key witness who evaded Dematagoda Ruwan’s Rs. 1.5 Bn illegal asset case remanded
byline: A key witness who had been evading court warrants in the High Court case concerning the illegal acquisition of assets worth Rs. 1.5 billion linked to Dematagoda Ruwan was remanded by Colombo Chief Magistrate Tanuja Lakmali until March 17.

title: Mark Carney sworn in as Canada’s new prime minister
byline: Mark Carney has been sworn in as Canada’s new prime minister after Justin Trudeau formally resigned to end nearly a decade in power.

title: Heavy showers expected in several provinces
byline: Fairly heavy showers exceeding 50 mm are anticipated in certain areas within the Western and Sabaragamuwa Provinces, as well as in the districts of Galle, Matara and Kurunegala.

title: Shooting in Ambalangoda claims one life
byline: A shooting incident that occurred on Thursday evening in the Idamthota area of Ambalangoda has resulted in the death of a 45-year-old individual.
